content: easy crochet towel topper pattern by dawn lawson-weingaertner make a set of two towels with crochet topper materials dish/hand towel - approx 15 x 25 cut in half two 15 x 12 1/2 pieces coordinating worsted weight 4 yarn decorative button - 1 - 1 1/4 in diameter scissors blunt end darning needle hook size us h/8 5mm us d/3 or e/4 with pointed hook end gauge 4 double_crochet = 1 not important for this pattern stitch abbreviations slip_stitch - slip_stitch chain - chain single_crochet - single_crochet double_crochet - double_crochet decrease - double_crochet 2 together note ch3 counts as first double_crochet of next row last double_crochet of each row is made in top of turning ch3 of previous row make row 1 single_crochet stitches tall enough so towel edge remains flat and doesn t bunch instructions prep towel find midpoint of towel along longer edge and cut in half crosswise for each half of towel fold cut edge toward back of towel 1/4 - twice iron and pin or sew folded edge in place you will crochet over this edge row 1 with small hook and wrong side of towel facing attach yarn with slip_stitch at top right corner of towel just below folded edge ch1 40 single_crochet evenly across top edge of towel change to large hook ch3 turn 40 row 2 double_crochet in next st double_crochet in ea st across ch3 turn 40 row 3 double_crochet in next st decrease double_crochet 5 times 3 decrease double_crochet decrease 5 times 2 double_crochet ch3 turn 27 row 4 double_crochet in next st and in ea st across ch3 turn 27 row 5 double_crochet in next st 4 decrease double_crochet decrease 3 times 3 decrease 2dc ch3 turn 17 row 6 double_crochet in next st 3 decrease double_crochet 3 decrease 2 double_crochet ch3 turn 11 row 7 double_crochet in next st and in ea st across ch3 turn 11 row 8 2 decrease double_crochet 2 decrease double_crochet ch3 turn 7 row 9 decrease 2dc in next st decrease double_crochet ch3 turn 6 row 10-16 double_crochet in next st and ea st across ch3 turn 6 row 17 double_crochet in next st ch2 skip 2 st double_crochet in next st button hole made double_crochet ch3 turn 6 row 18 double_crochet in next st double_crochet in ea chain 2 double_crochet fasten_off and weave in ends 6 edging with right side of towel facing you attach yarn with slip_stitch in beg single_crochet chain 1 single_crochet evenly around edge of each row single_crochet chain single_crochet in ea corner at top edge fasten_off and weave in ends crocheted button round 1 make magic_ring ch1 8 single_crochet in circle slip_stitch to beg chain ch1 8 round 2 16 single_crochet in ea circle slip_stitch in beg chain slip_stitch in ea st around slip_stitch in beg chain fasten_off leaving 6 tail with tail attach button to front of topper in middle sts of row 8 or decorative button attach button to front of topper in middle sts of row
